intro: Achyronia marginata, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or grayish appearance due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Achyronia marginata is often found in open habitats such as plains, hillsides, and along roadsides.
